title: Fiat Lux Freshman Seminars
description: Seminar, one hour. Discussion of and critical thinking about topics of current intellectual importance, taught by faculty members in their areas of expertise and illuminating many paths of discovery at UCLA. P/NP grading.

title: Religion in Classical India: Introduction
description: (Same as Religion M60D.) Lecture, three hours; discussion, one hour. Introduction to religions of classical India—Vedic, Brahmanical, Hindu, Jain, and Buddhist—paying equal attention to change and continuity, with emphasis on chronological development. P/NP or letter grading.
satisfies: General Education - Literacy & Cultural Analysis (Arts & Humanities)
General Education - Philosophical & Linguistic Analysis (Arts & Humanities)

title: Honors Seminars
description: Seminar, three hours. Limited to 20 students. Designed as adjunct to lower-division lecture course. Exploration of topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities and led by lecture course instructor. May be applied toward honors credit for eligible students. Honors content noted on transcript. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Honors Contracts
description: Tutorial, three hours. Limited to students in College Honors Program. Designed as adjunct to lower-division lecture course. Individual study with lecture course instructor to explore topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities. May be repeated for maximum of 4 units. Individual honors contract required. Honors content noted on transcript. Letter grading.

title: Student Research Program
description: Tutorial (supervised research or other scholarly work), three hours per week per week per unit. Entry-level research for lower-division students under guidance of faculty mentor. Students must be in good academic standing and enrolled in minimum of 12 units (excluding this course). Individual contract required; consult Undergraduate Research Center. May be repeated. P/NP grading.

title: Elementary Sanskrit
description: Lecture, three hours. Introduction to script and grammar, with reading exercises and attention to significance of Sanskrit for understanding of other Indo-European languages. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Intermediate Sanskrit
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 110A. Advanced aspects of grammar and reading of literary texts. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Advanced Sanskrit
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 110B. Reading of entire Bhagavadgitaor comparable amount of other Sanskrit literature. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Readings in Sanskrit
description: Lecture, three hours. Requisite: course 110C. Extensive reading in such texts as best serve students’ needs. May be repeated for credit with consent of instructor. P/NP (undergraduates), S/U (graduates), or letter grading.

title: Classical Indian Literature in Translation
description: Lecture, three hours. Knowledge of Asian languages not required. Survey of some landmarks of classical Indian literature from second millennium BCE into second millennium CE, including both poetry and prose, high art and more popular genres, and secular and religious texts, examined in their social and institutional contexts. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Topics in South Asian Cinema and Literature
description: Lecture, three hours. Knowledge of Hindi/Urdu not required. Critical analysis of language and culture in South Asian diaspora as represented in films and/or literature. May be repeated once for credit. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Buddhism in India
description: (Same as Religion M161D.) Lecture, three hours; discussion, one hour. Knowledge of Indian languages not required. Overview of social and doctrinal history of Buddhism from its origin to its disappearance in India, based not only on texts but on archaeological, art historical, and inscriptional sources. Examination of both formal doctrine and actual practices and on what learned Buddhists wrote and ordinary Buddhists did, saw, and made. Concurrently scheduled with course C260. Letter grading.

title: Variable Topics in South Asian Linguistics, Languages, and Cultures
description: Lecture, three hours. Knowledge of Hindi/Urdu may be required. Critical analysis of language and culture in South Asian linguistic area, exploring notions of India as linguistic area and as cultural area. May be repeated for credit. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Introduction to Indic Philosophy
description: Lecture, three hours. Survey of main trends in Indian philosophy from ancient to modern times. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Women and Gender in Ancient India
description: Lecture, three hours. Knowledge of Asian languages not required. Examination of position and function of women in ancient India, primarily through study of key religious and legal texts. Topics include women’s life cycle, relation to social institutions, and challenges to these ideals, especially in narrative literature. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Advanced Honors Seminars
description: Seminar, three hours. Limited to 20 students. Designed as adjunct to undergraduate lecture course. Exploration of topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities and led by lecture course instructor. May be applied toward honors credit for eligible students. Honors content noted on transcript. P/NP or letter grading.

title: Honors Contracts
description: Tutorial, three hours. Limited to students in College Honors Program. Designed as adjunct to upper-division lecture course. Individual study with lecture course instructor to explore topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities. May be repeated for maximum of 4 units. Individual honors contract required. Honors content noted on transcript. Letter grading.
